main_definition: A thin, flexible thread of metal used to conduct electricity or a phrase that conveys the idea of quick action or communication.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A strand of thin, flexible metal, typically made of copper or aluminum, used for transmitting electricity or signals from one point to another
meanings_and_examples.example: The electricians replaced the old copper wire with a new one in the house's wiring system.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression that emphasizes speed and efficiency, often used when someone acts quickly or communicates rapidly
meanings_and_examples.example: She shot off an email to confirm the meeting time; she really got on wire with it!

meanings_and_examples.definition: A phrase or idiomatic expression that suggests swift action or rapid communication
meanings_and_examples.example: When there was a change in plans, he had to get on the wires and inform everyone immediately.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of transmitting signals through a wire, such as telephone lines or internet connections
meanings_and_examples.example: Phone calls are made possible by transmitting voice signals through physical wires connecting different locations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A thin metal rope used in rigging and climbing equipment to provide support and stability
meanings_and_examples.example: The rock climber carefully secured his safety wire before attempting the challenging ascent.
